78;Gazyva;Como funciona Gazyva?;Gazyva é um anticorpo monoclonal que tem na sua composição a substância Obinutuzumab
column2: que pertence ao grupo dos agentes anti-neoplásicos ou agentes anticancerígenos. Os anticorpos monoclonais são proteínas muito específicas
column3: capazes de se ligar especificamente a outras proteínas do corpo. Gazyva é capaz de reconhecer e de se ligar muito especificamente à proteína CD20
column4: uma proteína encontrada na superfície dos glóbulos brancos
column5: também conhecidos como linfócitos B. Gazyva é assim capaz de interromper o crescimento anormal dos linfócitos B
column6: uma vez que o crescimento anormal destas células está na origem da leucemia linfocítica crônica.;" As a responsive and direct assistant
column7: I'm happy to help you with your question! Gazyva (obinutuzumab) is a type of cancer drug that works by targeting and destroying cancer cells. It is used to treat certain types of blood cancer
column8: including chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) and non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL).

column1: Gazyva is a monoclonal antibody
column2: which means it is made up of a single type of antibody that is produced in the laboratory. It is designed to bind to a protein called CD20
column3: which is found on the surface of cancer cells. When Gazyva binds to CD20
column4: it triggers the immune system to attack and destroy the cancer cells.

column1: Gazyva is given through a vein (intravenously) and is usually given in combination with other cancer drugs. It is important to note that Gazyva can cause side effects
column2: including infusion reactions
column3: fatigue
column4: nausea
column5: and diarrhea. Patients should be closely monitored by their healthcare team while taking Gazyva.
